[[Image:Uplands Pin.png|thumb|right|200px|A map showing the location of Uplands on the continent of Westeros.]]
'''Uplands''' is a castle in [[the Reach]], the region controlled by [[House Tyrell]] of [[Highgarden]]. The castle is located south of Highgarden and due east of [[Oldtown]].<ref>[http://viewers-guide.hbo.com/game-of-thrones/season1/#!/locations/highgarden/ HBO viewers guide, season 1 map, Highgarden entry]</ref>
sections.In the books:
In the ''[[A Song of Ice and Fire]]'' novels, Uplands is the seat of House Mullendore. It is located due east of Oldtown on a tributary of the [[Honeywine]], amongst the foothills of the [[Red Mountains]] (which give it its name). House Mullendore is a vassal of [[House Hightower]] of Oldtown rather than the Tyrells directly.

Ser Mark Mullendore of Uplands was a noted [[knight]] in the service of [[Renly Baratheon]], noted for his trained black-and-white monkey. He switched allegiance to [[Stannis Baratheon]] after Renly's death. He lost an arm in the [[Battle of the Blackwater]] and was taken prisoner by the [[House Lannister|Lannisters]]. He bent the knee and swore fealty back to the [[Iron Throne]].
